Definitions.Paraphrase:
taking great care to escape possible danger
十分小心的，谨慎的
I'm very cautious about expressing my opinions in public.
我对公开发表意见十分谨慎。
My brother, intensely cautious, never makes a decision lightly. 
我弟弟特别谨慎，从来不轻易作决定。

not expected or usual
异乎寻常的，不平常的
It's unusual for Mary to be late. 
玛丽很少迟到。

a person or thing that is not included  
除外，例外，除外的人或事
Most of his songs are awful but this one is an exception.  
他的歌大多数很糟糕，但这首歌是例外。
There's an exception to every rule. 
每条规则都有例外。

remove hair from the face or another part of the body with a razor  
剃去......上的毛发，剃......的胡须
I was shaving when the doorbell rang. 
门铃响时我正在刮胡子。

not recently shaved
未剃须的，未修面的，有短髭的
He looked pale and unshaven.
他看上去脸色苍白，胡子拉碴。

(usu.pl.)
长（统）袜，袜子
a pair of stockings  
一双长（统）袜
stocking cap
圆锥形绒线帽，针织帽
耐纶制的，尼龙的
耐纶织品，尼龙织品

a small bush  
灌木

a helicopter larding pad.
（停车的）地方，（简易机场的）飞机起落段
a strong piece of material or lether worn to protect the arms or knees, etc.
垫，衬垫
a knee pad.
护膝

a small gun that you hold in one hand  
手枪
He aimed the pistol and fired.  
他把手枪瞄准就开了火。

manage to do or make something although there are difficulties
设法做到
She contrived to live well on a very small income. 
她靠微簿的收入生活得很好。

throw into or through the air 
扔，抛，掷
She tossed the ball into the air. 
她把球抛到了空中。

1. speak to someone in a loud voice with an angry or aggressive tone  
厉声地说，咆哮
The boss came in, barked some orders and left again. 
老板走了进来，厉声下达了命令，然后又出去了。
2. (used about dogs) make a loud, short noise or noises 
（狗）吠，叫
His dog always barks at anyone who rings the doorbell.
他家的狗冲任何按门铃的人都要叫。

natural habit of behaving in a particular way, without thinking and without having been taught 
本能，天性
As winter approaches, birds fly south from Canada by instinct. 
当冬天来临时，鸟儿出于本能会离开加拿大，飞往南方。

（出于）本能地，（出于）天性地 
I instinctively raised my arm to protect my face.
我本能地举起手臂保护自己的脸。

a small case made of cloth, animal skin or plastic, etc. carried in the pocket and used for holding paper money, personal papers, etc.  
皮夹子

（尤指男子穿的）长裤，西（装）裤
He wore a pair of black trousers. 
他穿着一条黑裤子。

to or towards one side 
（斜）向一边（或一侧），向旁边
A strong blast of wind blew the car sideways off the road.
一阵狂风把汽车吹到了路边。

1. thin and light 
瘦小的
He looked too slight to be a boxer.
他看上去很瘦小，不能当拳击手。
2. small; not great; not very bad  
少量的；轻微的；不严重的
We have a slight problem.  
我们遇到了一个小问题。
She has a slight cold.
她患了轻度感冒。
There has been a slight change in your work. 
你的工作已有所改进。

make something larger  
扩大，扩展，使增大
They enlarged their house.
他们把自己的屋子扩大了一些。
She had the photograph enlarged.
她把这张照片放大了。

1. make something smooth and shiny by rubbing 
擦，擦光，擦亮
She polished her shoes. 
她擦了擦自己的鞋。 
2. improve  
使完美，改进
I need to polish up my Chinese before we go on vacation.  
我需要在我们度假前提高一下自己的汉语水平。

not expected; sudden  
没有料到的，突如其来的
His reaction was quite unexpected. 
他的反应出乎预料。
his unexpected death
他的暴卒  
an unexpected visit
突然的访问

in a way that is not expected 
没有料到地，突如其来地
He returned unexpectedly.
他突然回来了。

tie or join something to something else  
系，贴，连接
I attached a name card to my bag.  
我在包上贴了一张名片。

against law  
犯罪的，犯法的，刑事的
Stealing is a criminal wrong. 
偷窃是刑事犯罪。

a person who is at fault in a crime 
罪犯

a person who suffers harm or death as a result of someone else's action or a natural terrible event, etc. 
受害者，牺牲者
a victim of war 
战争受害者
Food is being sent to the victims of the natural terrible event. 
食品正被送往遭受严重自然灾害的灾民们。

1. break a law, etc. 
违法，违犯
His actions offended against the rules of proper behavior. 
他的行为违背了举止得体的准则。
offend against the law 
违法
2. make someone feel upset or angry  
冒犯，触怒
If you don't go to her party she will be offended.
如果你不出席她的宴会，她会生气的。
He was offended at /by her words.
她的话令他很生气。
She may be offended if you don't reply to her request to attend.  
你不回复她的邀请，她也许会不高兴的。

a person who offends against the law  
犯法的人，犯规的人
a sex offender
性犯罪者    
a first offender  
初犯者

a person who uses particular goods, machines or services  
使用者，用户
users of public transport
公共交通使用者
Unemployed people are the main users of this advice center. 
失业者是这个咨询中心的主要客户。
Telephone users will be facing higher bills next quarter.
电话用户下季度将面临电话费涨价的问题。

(often pl.)a small part or piece  
细节，详情
She paid close attention to the details. 
她特别注意细节。
She insisted on telling me every single detail of what theydid to her in hospital. 
她执意要告诉我他们在医院里对她所做的每个细节。
I recalled every detail of the party. 
我回忆起了宴会的每个细节。

remove something with speed and violence, using one's hands; tear 
猛力扯掉，猛力移去，猛力去除
She ripped the phone from his hand.  
她从他手中把电话筒夺了过来。
He ripped the cover from the book.  
他把书的封面撕了下来。

the part of one's arm at the joint between hand and forearm 
腕，腕关节
I can't play tennis； I've hurt my wrist. 
我不能打网球，我的腕关节弄伤了。

an area of grass in a garden or park that is regularly cut  
草坪，草地
I'm going to cut the lawn this afternoon.  
我打算今天下午把草坪修剪一下。

matter that is not clean, such as dust or wet earth 
污物，烂泥，灰尘
Wipe the dirt off your shoes before you come in. 
进来前先把你鞋上的尘土擦去。

the part of the face above the eyebrows  
额，前额
Her hair covers her forehead. 
她的头发盖住了前额。

either of the flat parts of one's head at the side of your forehead  
太阳穴
The stone hit him on the temple. 
石头击中他的太阳穴。

(in the Christian faith) God or Jesus Christ  
上帝，耶稣基督
Lord, hear our request. 
上帝啊，听听我们的祈求吧。

kindness to sb. 
慈悲，怜悯，仁慈
He showed his enemies no mercy.
他对敌人毫不心慈手软。

wrong; a wicked act, especially one that breaks a religious law 
(违背道德规范的)罪；罪恶；（违犯宗教戒律的）罪孽
Lying and stealing are both sins.
撒谎和行窃都是罪孽。
He believes it is a sin for two people to live together without being married. 
他认为未婚同居是罪孽。

do wrong to commit a sin  
违反教规，违犯戒律，犯罪

a person who sins  
（宗教、道德上的）罪人

the sound made by walking 
脚步（声）
She heard his footsteps on the stairs. 
她听到了他在楼梯上的脚步声。

the full time for which anything lasts  
一段时间，持续时间
Seventy or eighty years is the normal span of a human life.
七十岁或八十岁是一个人的正常寿命。

cook in hot oil or fat  
油煎，油炒
Shall I fry the eggs or boil them? 
我是煎鸡蛋，还是煮鸡蛋呢？

without end; lasting for ever 
永恒的，永久的，不断的
The company is engaged in the eternal search for goods that will lead the market. 
这家公司坚持不懈地致力于寻求一种能主导市场的产品。

1. the state or time after death  
不朽，来世
2. time without end  
永恒，无穷

1. someone who connects telephone calls 
电话接线员，机务员，话务员
Ask the operator to connect you to that number. 
请电话接线员给你接通那个电话。
2. someone who works a machine 
操作员，技工
a lift operator  
电梯操作员

steal from a person, place, etc. 
抢劫
He robbed a bank. 
他抢劫了一家银行。
They robbed me of my watch. 
他们抢走了我的手表。

a person who steals from a person, place, etc. 
抢劫者，强盗，盗贼
The bank robber got away with nearly $50,000. 
银行抢劫犯携着将近5万美元逃走了。

the crime of stealing from a person, place, etc.  
抢劫罪，抢劫（案）
Robbery is a serious crime. 
抢劫是一种严重犯罪。
He was charged with four robberies. 
他被指控犯有四起抢劫罪。

1. (used about alcoholic drink) strong 
（酒）浓的，烈性的
He poured himself a stiff whisky. 
他给自己倒了一杯烈性威士忌酒。
2. very firm; not easily bent or folded; rigid  
僵硬的，挺的，不易弯曲的
He has walked with a stiff leg since he hurt his knee.  
他自从膝关节受伤后走起路来一条腿一直伸不直。

extra 
额外的，另外的
There will be an extra charge for any additional passengers.
任何额外的乘客都需另外付费。
additional cost 
额外费用 
additional problems
另外的问题

a continuous flowing movement of water, air, etc.
（水、空气等的）流，潮流
You shouldn't swim in the river. There are dangerous currents.  
你不应该在这条河里游泳，这河的水流很危险。

from or about the present time
现时的，当前的
current news
当前的新闻

[U] great sadness
哀愁

1. the idea, law, or fact on which something is based  
基础，基本原理，根据
That imagined story is completely without foundation. 
这凭空想象出来的事儿完全没有根据。
2. an organization established with money so that it may continue into the future
基金会
3. the act of founding something  
建立，设立
the foundation of a new school  
一所新学校的创办

1. now
现在，目前
The managers are presently discussing the matter with the workers. 
管理人员目前正在与工人讨论这件事。
2. soon  
不久，一会儿
Take a seat in the waiting room; the doctor will see you presently. 
在候诊室坐一会儿，医生马上会来给你看病。

a wall built across a river to hold back the water and form a lake behind it  
坝，堤
There was a flood when the dam burst. 
决堤时造成洪水泛滥。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
1. close to and looking at someone or something  
面对面的／地
I'd like to meet him face to face someday; I've heard so much about him. 
我很想有一天能直接见见他，我已听到了很多关于他的情况，。
2. no escape from sth. and having to deal with it 
必须面对的，无法回避的
What would you do or say if you are face to face with guns? 
如果有人用枪对着你，你会怎么办？或者会说什么？

arrive and stop; move to (one side)
（车）停靠；驶向（一旁等）
He pulled into the small parking lot.  
他把车开进了一个小停车场。
The London train pulled into the branch line station.  
这列伦敦火车缓缓驶进了支线车站。

with the appearance of; apparently 
好象
He behaved as if nothing had happened. 
他的举止就好像什么都没发生过似的。

fix something to something else; join to  
系在......上；连接到......上
Attach the handle  to the box.
把提手柄装到箱子上去。

instead of; less likely
而不
It's the managers that are at fault rather than the workers. 
是管理人员的过错, 而不是工人们的过错。
I think I'll have a cold drink rather than coffee.  
我想要一杯冷饮料而不是咖啡。

give kindness to an enemy, sinner, one who does wrong, etc. 
可怜某人
Have mercy on me!  
可怜可怜我吧!

stand up 
站起来
At the end of game, the whole crowd got to their feet and cheered wildly. 
比赛结束时，整个人群都站起来疯狂地欢呼。

look quickly in; examine or study carefully 
仔细检查，浏览 
I'll look through my notes but I don't think I have a record of his name. 
我仔细查看了一下笔记，却发现没有记下他的名字。
Look through your examination paper for any small mistakes, before you hand it in.
交卷前，仔细检查一下你的试卷，看看有没有什么小错。
I looked through the letter again but could find no sign of worry. 
我又把信仔细地看了一遍，可没有发现什么让人担心的迹象。

be impossible to deal with or guide 
失去控制
The revolution was out of control and fighting broke out. 
革命已失去了控制，发生了打斗。

damage or destroy bit by bit
 逐渐毁掉，侵蚀
The sea has been eating away at this shore for centuries. 
几百年来海水一直在侵蚀着海岸。

Kentucky Fried Chicken  
肯德基炸鸡连锁店

the Los Angeles Police Department  
洛杉矶警察局
布莱克（1757－1827，英国诗人和版画家）
(the)  英国英格兰南部泰晤士河（流经牛津、伦敦等）
